generif.text: Hepatocyte growth factor induces collagenase (matrix metalloproteinase-1) via the transcription factor Ets-1 in human hepatic stellate cell line.

results showed a significant correlation between microvessel counts and ets-1 gene expression levels in uterine cervical cancers;localization of ETS-1 was similar to that of vascular endothelial cells

results showed a significant correlation between microvessel count and ets-1 gene expression levels in uterine endometrial cancers; localization of ETS-1 was similar to that of vascular endothelial cells

Studies implicate ETS1 as a crucial regulator of broader oncogenic processes such as EMT and cellular invasion. ETS1 preferentially binds cancer specific regulator elements, in particular Super-Enhancers of key EMT genes, highlighting its role as a master regulator. wikipathways.name: Apoptosis-related network due to altered Notch3 in ovarian cancer

summary: This gene encodes a member of the ETS family of transcription factors, which are defined by the presence of a conserved ETS DNA-binding domain that recognizes the core consensus DNA sequence GGAA/T in target genes. These proteins function either as transcriptional activators or repressors of numerous genes, and are involved in stem cell development, cell senescence and death, and tumorigenesis. Alternatively spliced transcript variants encoding different isoforms have been described for this gene.[provided by RefSeq, Jul 2011].
